page.title: 06Saltmarsh Plant Life
page.content: Saltmarsh Plant Life ******************** The{saltmarshes}which were created by the silting up of the{ {River Dee,}have been helped to spread quickly by the growth of grass. This grass is called{Sartina}and was planted on the Welsh side of the river in the{1920's}to bind the sand together for land reclamation. It was not successful but somehow appeared in the Cheshire side at{Gayton}where it was not wanted but was successful. It has bound together the sand and replaced the sea shore with a saltmarsh from Gayton to Parkgate.
